Title: Release of flammable substances which ignited from a petrol hydrotreatment unit (HDH) in a refinery
LessonsLearned: The main points are as follows:<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; - There was no UVCE (Unconfined Vapour Cloud Explosion) because the product was already at a temperature higher than its flash point.<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; - It was possible to limit damage due to the fact that the heat resisting lines and reactors did not fail, in spite of the low flow rate of the charge within vessels and pipework, the flow of the charge being&nbsp; an essential element for cooling the equipment.<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; - Because of the position of water curtains, the fire did not spread.<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; - The positioning of the curtains was sensible as regards the vertical position of the plume: This was because the choice of siting of the cannons prevented any domino effect which there could well have been in view of the configuration of the site (units separated by bays about fifteen metres wide).<br><br>Technical issues: improvements to limit the consequences of a similar leak are as follows:<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; - Increase of the decompression speed of the reactor section of the reformer by changing a gas venting valve to an oil-gas system.<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; - Modification of a pressure relief valve currently operated at a pressure threshold, it will now be controllable from the control room console.<br><br>Organisational issues: the operator has implemented dimensional inspection procedures for seal seats in exchangers.<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; - Special approval is now required for personnel undertaking this type of work, with the corresponding appropriate training,<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; - For outside contractors doing this type of work, the introduction of routine dimensional inspection reports on the seal seats and stop points are scheduled after upgrading, before finalising assembly and during reassembly.<br><br>
EmergencyResponce_Descr: As regards fire-fighting operations, see the sequence of events paragraph in chapter 3 (Immediate Source(s) of Accident).<br><br>In addition to the repairs recommended by an organisation expert in metallurgy, the operator finally implemented a programme to refurbish the affected section in accordance with the recommendations of the American standard "API RP 570 - section 11 - Assessment of fire damage".<br>In particular, the following actions were taken:<br>-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mapping the sectors affected,<br>-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Refurbishment procedure including a visual inspection, ultrasonic thickness tests, hardness tests and making replicas for metallographic tests <br>-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Replacing the pressure relief valves in the section,<br>-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Servicing valves in the section.<br><br>

Reasons.ItemDescription: Substances involved: greater than 5% of quantity in Column 3 of Annex I
Injury to persons: >= 1 fatalities, >= 6 hospitalizing injuries etc.
Immediate damage to the environment (according to Annex VI)

AccidentDescription: The accident was caused by the release of flammable substances which ignited from a petrol hydrotreatment unit (HDH) in a refinery. <br><br>The accident was notified because of the cost of the damage to facilities (4.3 MEuros). It was classified level 3 of the scale, as published&nbsp; in February 1994 by the Committee of Competent Authorities for the implementation of the Seveso directive,&nbsp; in accordance with that criterion.<br><br><b><br>The accident:<br></b>A leak occurred at the reboiler seal surface, on the hot fluid side, and immediately ignited causing an almost vertical plume of flame a dozen metres long.<br>The purpose of the reboiler is to provide the energy necessary for the column to operate. The column consists of the pre-treatment stripper, depending on the hydrotreatment unit. It is a preparation phase for the reformer input. The reboiling energy is provided by the output from the reformer.<br><br>The sequence of events:<br>The settings (pressure and associated throughputs) on the two circuits, analysed after the accident, show that the leak occurred on the hot fluid side (thus containing output from the reformer). The description of the sequence of events is as follows:<br>&nbsp;<br>- 20h23:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Fire started,<br>- 20h25:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; West units called to the fire. Site siren triggered.<br>- 20h30:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Fire-fighters left - Emergency stop of the reformer - closure of shut-off valves due to fault - Start of decompression of the unit - gas sent to the flare<br>- 20h32:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Stand-by management called and home phone connection made (stage 1)<br>- 20h34:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Stand-by management called and home phone connection made (stage 2)<br>- 20h50:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Head of safety/security arrives.<br>- 20h55:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Nangis fire brigade arrives (1 fire engine +5 crew) tasked with installing a second cannon on the west side.<br>- 20h56:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Departmental fire and rescue service called to report the sending of reinforcements<br>- 21h00:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mormant fire brigade arrives (5 fire-fighters) tasked with preparing two 1,000 l/min fire hoses.<br>- 21h10:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; A carpet of foam laid down.<br>- 21h11:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Water curtain with cannon to the West of the area on fire<br>- 21h35:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Deviation set up by the police on the RN19 trunk road<br>- 21h45:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Pre-positioning of a 4th canon, which was not used.<br>- 23h21:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Fire put out and 3 cannons stopped - 2 cannons were kept in place for a time either side of the unit.<br>- 23h25:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Deviation on the RN 19 trunk road ceased<br>- 23h30:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Fire-fighters stood down - Facilities inerted with nitrogen.<br>- 1h00:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; End of emergency.<br><br>As regards the offsite emergency response services, the fire brigade was called by motorists passing the site. Subsequently, 20 fire engines were parked in front of the refinery, as the refinery only authorised 2 fire engines to enter the site, for safety reasons. The 18 fire engines thus waited off-site until the emergency was over.<br><br><br><br><br>

Site_Description: The refinery produces the usual range of oil products (LPG, kerosene, petrol, diesel, domestic fuel oils, bitumen, etc.). It was commissioned in 1966. It has a production capacity of 4,800,000 t/year and a storage capacity of 1,243,000 m#. 355 people work at the site. <br><br><table><tbody><tr><td><br></td><td><br></td><td><br></td><td><br></td></tr></tbody></table>
Installation_Description: The fire occurred in the hydrotreatment and catalytic reforming units located at the West of the refinery.<br><br>The purpose of the hydrotreatment unit is to remove sulphurous, nitrogenous and oxygenated components and also metal components present in the whole stabilised petrol coming from atmospheric distillation. The purpose of this operation is to protect the catalyst in the catalytic reforming reactor, sited downstream, which is damaged by this type of component. <br>The purpose of the catalytic reforming unit is to produce a high octane rating fuel base (the reformate) from an input of low octane rating. It also produces the hydrogen necessary for the hydrotreatment and hydrogen desulphuring units. <br>

Description: A blend of petrol, petrol gases (fuel-gas, butane, propane) and hydrogen flows in the exchanger of the reboiler. Its temperature is 440Â°C at a pressure of 25 bars.<br>

Causes_Description: According to the initial findings and reports, the leak was due to a fault originating in the exchanger which had a dimensional concentricity defect in the throat of the seal housing. This had caused problems with the work of reassembling the unit while stopped for maintenance prior to the accident. It was because the different parts were incorrectly seated.<br><br>The seal, obtained by cold tightening the metal parts onto one another, gave way during the run-up to high temperatures. The accident thus occurred during this transition phase.<br><br><br>
